title: Maison L'Envoyé 2014 The Attaché Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This cuvée is a barrel selection, aged in 35% new oak. It's a mix of cola, beet root, stem and earth flavors, but lacks the presence of ripe fruit. In fact, it feels a bit green through the finish.

title: Manciat-Poncet 2014 Le Clos  (Saint-Véran)
description: This is a crisp wine, tight with minerality. It has apple fruits as well as citrus, although the wine tends to a tight texture. There is potential and the wine will soften from 2016, but it will always have this tension.

title: Manos Negras 2015 Atrevida Chardonnay (Agrelo)
description: Aromas of vanilla and Animal crackers are light on fruit. Delicate on the palate, this offers lychee and tropical fruit flavors that suggest Torrontés. A pithy finish is braced by bright acidity.

title: Nightstar 2015 Sweet Red Dornfelder (Rheinhessen)
description: Ripe ruddy flavors of black-cherry pie and plum preserves are concentrated in this straightforward fruity wine. While semisweet and a touch jammy on the palate, its delicate abv and juicy style make it a pleasant summer sip.

title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2013 Les Vergers Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)
description: This wine has wood acidity more than fruit freshness, but its citrus and apple flavors show potential. Although spice and toast dominate for the moment, a crisper character comes through at the end.

title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2014 Les Chaboeufs Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: Strong wood flavors dominate this wine. While there are hints of the juicy red fruits, the burnt toast is too strong. While that will soften, it seems likely that woodiness will be with the wine a long time.

title: Pedernales 2015 Reserve Viognier (Texas)
description: Muddled peach, apricot and vanilla cream carry the nose, while the palate is a bit more savory in character, with almond notes pervading over lilting flowers and tart apricot. There's a nice roundness to the palate and proper acidity to match. A Fuzzy white-tea tannin texture carries the nutty finish.

title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Dom Diogo Colheita Seleccionada Arinto (Vinho Verde)
description: There is the faintest prickle on this dry, ripe and creamy wine. It has ripe acidity with crisp apple and green plum fruits. There is just the edge of minerality to give this wine texture. Drink now.

title: Moscato Rubino 2014 Sweet Red Muscat (California)
description: This sweet wine smells like ripe plums and tastes fresh, grapy and sugary, with a little sparkle in the texture. It's quite sweet on the finish, too.

title: Hawks View 2015 Cellar Series White Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Though labeled white, this is a pale rosé, 100% Pinot Noir and one-quarter barrel fermented in neutral oak. It's slightly nutty, with a touch of oxidation and flavors of toasted grain. More dry extract than fresh fruit, despite its youth, and what fruit is there is tart as rhubarb pie.

title: Herdade da Comporta 2015 White (Península de Setúbal)
description: Grown in sandy soil close to the sea, the wine is soft while also crisp. It is an attractive blend of Arinto and Antão Vaz, the two complementing each other with their fresh and fruity character. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)
description: Ripe yellow fruits give this wine a soft and rich character. With a tangy, citrus edge it is also crisp and fresh. The combination makes for a lively, light wine that is ready to drink.

title: La Vieille Ferme 2015 Red (Vin de France)
description: A deep purple color, this ripe selection leads with lush aromas of raspberry jam, blueberry and boysenberry, all of which carry through to the fruit-forward palate. Medium tannins and ample acidity provide good framing to the fruity richness, resulting in a crushed velvet texture. Drink now.

title: Tom Gore 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This smooth, almost soft, medium-bodied wine features tasty blackberry flavors, light tannins and a nice feeling of richness. It has a lot of flavor and an easy-drinking style.

title: Turasan 2014 Selda Red (Cappadocia)
description: Aromas of blackberry and thyme lead to flavors of slightly sour cherry, strawberry, thyme and oregano. Soft tannins provide a backdrop for refreshing fruit and savory flavors that are notably tart from start to finish.

title: Vite Colte 2008 Spezie Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Oak, leather, menthol, blue flower and stewed prune aromas lead the way. The tart, taut palate offers dried cherry, raw cranberry, clove and a green note of powdered sage while astringent tannins clench the finish.

title: Dow's NV Dow's Boardroom  (Port)
description: This is a ripe, sweet wine, full of toffee and smooth vanilla. There is just enough tangy bitter orange to give it a tawny character. The aftertaste, though, is soft and rounded.

title: Finca Flichman 2014 Misterio Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Savory but also stewy on the nose, this Malbec offers muddled berry and spiced cherry aromas. In the mouth, this is flush and jammy but not all that exact. Spicy, herbal, peppery plum and black-currant flavors finish with heat and roasted notes.

title: Falkner 2015 Viognier (Temecula Valley)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling still shows a vast array of tropical-leaning aromas, from jasmine and honeysuckle to ripe Gala apples, orange juice and key lime pie. Crisp stonefruit shows on the sip, as do more powerful white flowers, like tuberose.

title: Famille Laplace 2015 Aramis Rosé (Vin de France)
description: This is a ripe, red fruit and caramel flavored wine. With its strawberry flavor, balanced acidity and touch of spice, it is soft and rounded yet finishes with a fresh touch.

title: Fiuza 2015 Merlot (Tejo)
description: Ripe and soft, this is a smooth wine. With its attractive black fruits and the lightest touch of tannin, it is fruity with a hint of toast. Drink this wine now.

title: Geyser Peak 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Light floral aromas and more rich and savory flavors make this wine satisfying to drink. It's light-bodied, fairly soft in texture and has a light sugary finish.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Palha-Canas White (Lisboa)
description: Blending Chardonnay and Viognier with local grapes, the wine is smooth and creamy. It has apple and bright citrus flavors with a cool, crisp backdrop of acidity. The aftertaste, with its tangy, salty character is a reminder of the ocean climate of the region.

title: Casanel 2014 Chardonnay (Middleburg)
description: Ripe peach and lemon meet graham cracker on the nose and palate. Medium in weight, with a slightly flabby feel, green apple acidity works hard to maintain balance.

title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Douro)
description: An unoaked wine that relies on its black fruits. While there are light tannins, it is the berry flavors and attractive acidity that carry the day. The wine with its final lift is ready to drink.

title: Château de Santenay 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)
description: Sourced from grapes grown in the Côte Chalonnaise, this is a soft, red-fruit-flavored wine, with a ripe, jammy character that makes it almost sweet. It is ready to drink.

title: Boasso 2012 del Comune di Serralunga  (Barolo)
description: This opens with whiffs of cellar floor, underbrush, scorched soil, game and a hint of sweat. The gamy note follows through to the rustic palate, along with fleshy black fruit and a note of powdered sage.

title: Brennan 2015 Viognier (Texas)
description: A delicate balance of geranium, peach blossom and ginger cookie shows on the nose and palate, with an additional herbal hop notes chiming in for the flavors. There's good acidic verve to counterattack the broad palate, making this rich white a solid choice for cedar-plank grilled fish.

title: Cuma 2015 Made with Organic Grapes Torrontés (Cafayate)
description: Familiar varietal aromas of lychee and scented candle come with a hint of petrol. Punchy and crisp in feel, this tastes of garden variety lemon-lime, banana and lychee. A crisp but rudimentary finish closes things out.

title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Domaine de la Garenne  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: Tangy and juicy, this is a bright, still tight wine. A strong mineral character dominates the texture and suggests the wine needs time to allow the crisp citrus and acidity to come through. Drink from 2017.
